content.rendered: In another life, Ben Erwin ran the National Call Center for Hair Club for Men. There he developed his data skills, reporting appointment statistics for 60 salons across the US and Canada. In 1997, it was the frontier of this thing called the Internet represented vast opportunity, so he started his own business and taught himself to make websites. Powersimple began making small brochure sites for artists and entrepreneurs and later became a contractor for the United Nations for 13 years.  Later, Powersimple developed native advertising campaigns for working for agencies such as EmberMedia, Likeable Media, and the New York Times’ T-Brand Studio.
